definition: at stake/in peril
danger/to endanger/Taiwan pr. [wei2]
surname Wei
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased

sentences.english: Chu people of peril and suffering, pain Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 楚國的危亡和百姓的痛苦，屈原痛不欲生。

sentences.english: Look back, and smile at perils past.
One who can save the populace from imperilment, is able to attain security and peace in populace.
sentences.chinese: 能挽救天下於危亡的，就能使得天下安寧。

definition: calamity
(of a country) to perish/to be annexed/subjugation (to a foreign power)
to live or die/to exist or perish
to save the nation
(literary) foreign aggression/external threat/humiliation inflicted by outsiders
(of a nation) to be destroyed/subjugation/vanquished nation
country destroyed, its people annihilated (idiom); total destruction
fall (of an empire)
in danger of collapse/in a parlous state/(of person) treacherous
to sacrifice one's wealth to save the state (idiom)
to sacrifice one's life
state/country/the Gods of earth and grain
the country ruined and the people starving (idiom)
to save from extinction/to save the nation
to flourish and decay/rise and fall
to meet with disaster/killed/in the clutches of the enemy/to fall foul of/in danger
